page.title: 03Introducing the Peak Park
page.content: The Toads Mouth, so called because of the protruding rock resembling that creature, heralds the start of the Surprise stretch, but another road and a footpath lead down to the ancient Padley Chapel and a more wooded area to explore. The Roman Fort still stands proudly over the Hathersage moor. Further round, above Stanage moor, the now familiar sight of hang-gliders leaping off the rocks on expensive Vulture like contraptions signifies mans constant desire to emulate the bird family. In the distance, a glider, a lightweight motorless plane, may be seen silently drifting into sight from the Abney club, a less fateful form of escaping from the pressures of life in 1985. The Millstone Inn, at the tip of Hathersage is enormously popular for its bar meals.
